page.title: 12FARMING (TWO)
page.content: The land borders the south Shropshire Clee hills. In the west it reaches 350m, falling, sometimes very steeply, to 160m in Farlow village. The farms are mostly family farms, the majority of which are defined by the Ministry of Agriculture as "less favoured". These farms support more than one household within the the family but employ little regular outside labour. Some farmers earn additional income by contracting services and machinery. Most farming is mixed, i.e. cattle and sheep with some arable. There are a few dairy herds. One farm specialises in arable crops. The six smaller farms are also farmed intensively but do not as a rule provide the only source of income to the farmer. A few houses in the area have a small amount of land but are not seriously involved in agriculture.
